subject: Philosophy
title: Art and Imitation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Art and Imitation.

hook.text: Plato wanted to ban poets from his ideal city. He thought art was a dangerous copy of reality.

buildup.text: His theory of mimesis says art imitates the world, which itself imitates the Forms. A copy of a copy.

discovery.text: Aristotle defended art. Imitation isn't weakness â€” it's how humans learn and find catharsis.

twist.text: Modern art broke mimesis. A Rothko painting imitates nothing, yet it moves people to tears.

climax.text: Art evolved from copying nature to expressing what nature can't say.

punchline.text: Art stopped imitating and started creating.

quiz.question: Why did Plato distrust art?
options: He saw it as a copy of a copy
